messages.title: Dear friends
messages.content: I grew up in Newcastle and it's been the greatest honour of my life to represent the city I call home. It's also been a daily struggle against a Tory government that has turned us into the food bank capital of Britain and stretched our NHS to breaking point. Now Theresa May has broken her promise not to call an early election. She's after a blank cheque for more unfair cuts and a reckless hard Brexit that will endanger jobs and public services in the North East. Newcastle Central needs an MP who will stand up for our jobs and public services at this critical time. A vote for me is a vote for a strong local voice who always put Newcastle first. Thank you for your support in the past. I hope I can count on it when you cast your vote on June the 8th. With best wishes, Chi Onwurah

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will raise the national minimum wage to £10 an hour, making work pay, and invest in new jobs.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Brexit deal that works for Newcastle
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will put the economy first in the Brexit negotiations protecting jobs and public services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Ensuring our NHS is funded properly
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will invest a further £6 billion each year and end the Tory cap for nurses, doctors and other NHS workers.
Labour will create a National Education Service, abolish university tuition fees and make adult education free and widely available.
Labour will invest £1.4 billion in upgrading North East transport, and build 1 million homes over the next five years.

issues.brexitEurope: A Brexit deal that works for Newcastle, putting the economy first and protecting jobs and public services.
issues.economy: Creating good jobs for all, raising national minimum wage to £10 an hour, investing in new jobs.
issues.education: Making education open to everyone, abolishing university tuition fees, making adult education free and widely available.
issues.health: Ensuring our NHS is funded properly, investing a further £6 billion each year, ending the Tory cap for nurses, doctors and other NHS workers.
issues.labourEmployment: Creating good jobs for all, investing in new jobs.
issues.transport: Investing in transport, upgrading North East transport.

community.content: Investing in transport and housing, building 1 million homes over the next five years.

politicalExperience.role: MP for Newcastle upon Tyne Central
politicalExperience.achievements: Fighting for Newcastle in Parliament, holding the Government to account. Recently named hardest working MP in the North East.

contactInformation.address: 166 Wingrove Road, Newcastle upon Tyne, NE4 9BX

endorsements.endorsement: Chi supports the welfare of the people of Newcastle, backing the West End food bank and also working to make sure people can get proper jobs and don't need to rely on charity.
As an NHS worker I know Chi cares deeply about our public services and the difference they can make to Newcastle families.
Chi is passionate about the importance of education, championing University access for all and campaigning for lifelong learning.

images.caption: Chi cycling in the West End

examples: Labour will raise the national minimum wage to £10 an hour.
Labour will invest £1.4 billion in upgrading North East transport.
Labour will invest a further £6 billion each year into the NHS.
Investing in housing: building 1 million homes over the next five years.
Recently named hardest working MP in the North East by the Chronicle.
Voting date is on Thursday 8 June.
